intro: Alstonia polyphylla, commonly known as the African elephant tree, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a deciduous tree that can grow up to 20 meters tall, characterized by its thick, flaky bark and large, opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are followed by dark, round berries. Its botanical features make it well adapted to the hot, humid climates of its native region.
